DataElement.preferredName: Medical Record Colorectal Carcinoma Symptom Past Year Health Care Visit Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to indicate that there is a written account in a patient's record of a visit within the past calendar year due to symptomatology of colorectal cancer, such as change in bowel habits or rectal bleeing. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Medical Record Colorectal Carcinoma Symptom Past Year Health Care Visit
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A chronological written account of a patient's examination and treatment that includes documentation of a visit within the past calendar year for symptoms of colorectal cancer, such as change in bowel habits or rectal bleeding. [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A chronological written account of a patient's examination and treatment that includes the patient's medical history and complaints, the physician's physical findings, the results of diagnostic tests and procedures, and medications and therapeutic procedures. (dictionary.com):Grossly, most colorectal carcinomas are either polypoid or of the ulcerative -infiltrating type.  Adenocarcinoma is the most common carcinoma in the colon and rectum.  Colorectal adenocarcinoma can be divided in three grades: Grade I (low grade or well-di:An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: A chronological written account of a patient's examination and treatment that includes the patient's medical history and complaints, the physician's physical findings, the results of diagnostic tests and procedures, and medications and therapeutic procedures.
A malignant epithelial neoplasm that arises from the colon or rectum and invades through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Property.preferredDefinition: Past; before the present time.:The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.:A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional.

Concepts.definition: A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: In the past year (using today
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the past year (using today's date to determine time frame) does the chart document that the patient was seen for symptoms of colorectal cancer - for example, rectal bleeding or a change in bowel habits?

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support U of Minnesota adoption of C3D
